jobDescription: Responsibilities: · Responsible for organizing, planning, and directing the day to day operation and activities of the assigned functions. · Analyzes staffing needs, maintains employee records, prepares training and procedure manuals for specific teams. · Provides leadership within the department to decrease accounts receivable, increase productivity, increase quality of services, and decrease costs.Requirements:· Bachelor's degree in Business or related field· Must have 3+ years of lead or supervisory experience in healthcare, plus excellent verbal/written communication skills.· Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint required. · Must also possess analytical ability to exercise own judgment in determining actions that affect corporate cash flow. · Organizational and Interpersonal skills.· Ability to work extended hours beyond normal work schedule to include, but not limited to, evenings, weekends, extended shifts and/or extra shifts, sometimes on short notice.
